results.justification: The document explicitly states the research aims to "address the above gaps, in this work, we aim to 1) build an AI-driven pipeline and evaluate the effectiveness of leveraging speech & language processing..." and outlines the overall approach.
Section 3 provides a detailed step-by-step description of the study design, including participants, contexts, instruments, data collection, and analysis.
The document does not mention the public availability of the raw or processed datasets.
While the document mentions IRB approval, it doesn't explicitly state why the data cannot be shared, only that it was obtained.
Table 1 provides a coding scheme, which serves as a data dictionary explaining the categories and sub-categories used for coding the dialogue data.
Data collection methods are fully described in section 3.1 and 3.3, detailing the recruitment process, CT course, and video recording procedures.
The document does not mention the availability of the analysis code in an open repository.
No justification is provided for why the code is not shared.
The document mentions the use of ASR, VAD, and LLMs for data preparation but does not provide details or access to the code used for these processes.
Statistical tests (paired t-tests, lag sequential analysis) are mentioned and described, and the document references the CT framework used for analysis.
Effect sizes (Cohen’s d) and p-values are reported in Table 4.
The document provides subjective context and interpretation of the dialogue patterns identified through analysis (e.g., descriptions of the four clusters).
Data coding and analysis are clearly described, including the development of the coding scheme, inter-coder reliability (kappa values), and the process of identifying significant utterance sequences.
Results are clearly presented in tables (e.g., Table 2, Table 3, Table 4) and figures (e.g., Figure 2, Figure 3, Figure 4, Figure 5).
Section 5.1 and 5.2.3 discuss limitations of the study, such as the limited generalizability of the findings and potential biases related to student ability levels.
The document does not contain a link to a preregistration on platforms like the Open Science Foundation.
